text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with chicken parmesan casserole
that's right i decided to film a new HD
version of our incredibly popular
chicken dish this has gone viral on
pinterest like way viral so according to
my data and also some of my data this
could very well be one of the most
popular chicken recipes on the entire
internet true story alright i'm going to
start with 6 boneless skinless chicken
breasts now you want to pick these
carefully sometimes when you buy the big
packages you get different size chicken
breasts i would actually go to the
poultry department and buy them
individually from the butcher tell me
need 6 basically the same size these do
not have that little filleted and by the
way although that really doesn't matter
i'm going to season these very
generously on both sides with salt and
pepper now if you want these are ready
to go to build your casserole with the
recipe definitely works great without
browning them first as we did in the
original but if you have a few minutes
and you want to make this a little extra
special give them a 2 or 3-minute sear
on high heat a little bit of olive oil
which is going to give them a little bit
of color it's just going to deepen that
flavor a little bit again optional but
if you have time go for it and of course
any time you brown some meat you might
as well dig glaze the pan with a little
bit of water or stock and pour that over
your chicken that's a little extra
flavor why waste it alright so the
chicken is prepped to prep our baking
dish which is a 9 by 13 i'm going to put
in a little bit of extra virgin olive
oil and a little bit of red pepper flake
and brush that on the bottom if you guys
have seen the original video you
remember i did do a little crush garlic
in the base with the olive oil and the
pepper the reason i did this time is i
had a ton of garlic in my sauce so i
didn't need it but if you like garlic
you can definitely put some down once
that's set i'm going to go ahead and
place in my chicken breast 3 on one side
3 on the other and what I like to do
generally is try to keep the thickest
part of the chicken breast away from the
thickest part of the other chicken
breast so I'm no thermonuclear physicist
if that's even a thing but I do know if
the big thick parts are touching each
other the heats not going to distribute
is evenly is if they're not alright once
those are in there I'm going to spoon
over about two cups maybe two and a half
cups of a prepared tomato sauce and like
I mentioned mine had plenty of garlic in
it
also had some nice basil in there which
was a good thing because it's not summer
so there's not a lot of great basil
around if you are making this in August
throw in some freshly chopped basil it
will be even better
so once we spread the sauce as evenly as
possible over the top we're going to go
ahead and put on half the Parmesan
cheese and half the mozzarella cheese
and you know me I use the real stuff
alright so I'm going to sprinkle on the
parmesan I'm going to sprinkle on half
the mozzarella and it looks weird
because I'm using the really nice fresh
mozzarella which is almost impossible to
grate so basically kind of shreds and
balls up on the grater but that's okay
so again when it comes to the amounts of
cheese on the blog we're dividing that
in half half the Powerman morrow goes on
now half goes on the top alright so once
half our cheese is down we're going to
dump over a five ounce bag of croutons
ideally they're a small cube crouton
ideally they're you know high-quality
all natural you don't want any weird
artificial colors or flavors and
ingredients these particular ones I'm
using we're just lightly flavored with
garlic and herb so after the croutons
are on and press down firmly into the
sauce and cheese we're going to top that
with the other half of the mozzarella
and then the other half of the parmesan
last and that is ready for the oven all
right that's going to go in a very well
preheated 350 degree oven for it depends
between 35 and 45 minutes depending on
the size the shape the temperature etc
regarding your chicken breasts so don't
go by time go by temperature I like to
pull mine about 155 160 they're going to
continue to cook
alright so my took 35 minutes as you can
see they were certainly up to a proper
temperature of course you're going to
let this sit at least 10 minutes before
you serve are your food needs to relax a
little bit if it's too hot people just
aren't going to appreciate your awesome
cooking skills and to serve just find
the edge of the chicken breast with your
spoon of course if you cut this up it
doesn't matter but I like to serve one
breast per person and there you go
chicken parmesan casserole that all
false modesty aside is a genius dish
because it's so simple so easy and
really does mimic the taste and texture
of a chicken parmesan
the croutons are kind of a split
personality the bottom half the half
touching the chicken so
all that delicious tomato sauce and
juices from the chicken as it cooks the
top half of the crouton on the other
hand gets all crunchy and caramelized
with that cheese and it just works so
well and so much easier than traditional
chicken parmigiana
so if you're one of the few people in
America has not tried this yet I hope
you do head over to food wishes comm for
all the ingredient amounts and also a
ton of information regarding cooking
times and the differences between this
and the original version so go check
that out and as always enjoy
